results.title: Laura Poitras in New York City
results.brief_description: Laura Poitras blurs the line between documentary and investigative journalism. Poitras was one of three journalists confided in by whistleblower Edward Snowden when he shared classified documents that detailed global government surveillance. Telling his story earned Poitras a Pulitzer, while Citizenfour won an Oscar.

results.title: Laura's pregnant!
results.creator_credit: Jean Anne DeVoe, Deane Hutton and Queen Victoria Hospital Foundation
results.brief_description: Laura’s pregnant! follows 16 year old Laura as she discovers she is pregnant and reflects back on how it all happened, the myths her pregnancy refutes and how she and the baby’s father deal with the situation emotionally and the dilemmas they face. The program briefly explores her options of termination, adoption, marriage and single parenting, without revealing which decision she chooses. A teacher’s guide accompanies the video and provides activities around each section of the tape as well as an extensive bibliography. Suitable for lower and middle secondary school students.

results.title: Laura
results.creator_credit: Otto Preminger and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The haunting story of Laura - an elegant young woman viciously murdered, is told in a series of flashbacks from the perspective of acidic newspaper columnist Waldo Lydecker (Clifton Webb). Dana Andrews plays the detective who is investigating the murder and who finds himself becoming obsessed, and eventually falling in love with a portrait of the “dead” woman. Preminger’s direction is masterful and the cinematography deservedly won an Academy Award in 1944. The cast includes Judith Anderson, Vincent Price and most notably Gene Tierney as the mysterious and very beautiful Laura. Based on the novel by Vera Caspary.

results.title: Laundering woollen blankets in hospitals
results.brief_description: How woollen blankets which have been shrinkproofed and mothproofed may be laundered. The CSIRO’s shrink and mothproofing process; the advantages of woollen blankets; the basic procedures, which can be used in any hospital laundry with or without modern equipment.

results.title: Launceston and the River Tamar by John Glover, 1767-1849
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Australian eye II”.
Examines John Glover’s (1767-1849) sympathetic rendition of the countryside of Tasmania. ‘Launceston and the River Tamar’ (1832) was the earliest landscape breaking from the European manner.

results.title: Launceston
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Peter Young, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Aspects of life in Launceston. Industries include Paton and Baldwins woollen mills, Repco ball bearing factory, timber mills and furniture manufacturers. Shows schools, the general hospital, churches, and the historic home of Entally built in 1820. Motor racing at Longford, bicycyle racing, water skiing and archery are popular forms of recreation. Theatres, restaurants and night clubs, provide a variety of evening entertainment.

results.title: Laughter and hope
results.brief_description: In 1966 at the age of nine Maria Savarino was reunited with her parents who had migrated to Australia from Italy six years earlier. In doing so she also lost a very special person - her Aunt Maria, who had looked after her in those intervening years in Italy. This is Maria’s story about her very special namesake and role model.

results.title: Laugh slap howl
results.creator_credit: Cath Murphy and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: An animated film about an old lady and her dog living together in a block of flats who are disturbed by some unearthly noises coming from the hallway. Both scared, they proceed down the hall to a darkly lit room, the source of the strange noises.
